bug.author: cpoptic
bug.summary: pip install autokeras fails: "No matching distribution found for tensorflow>=1.10.1 (from autokeras)"
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Bug Description</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Reproducing Steps</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Step 1: ... at CMD prompt, type pip install keras Step 2: ...
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Setup Details</denchmark-h>
Include the details about the versions of: OS type and version: Windows 10, 64-bit Python: 3.6.6 autokeras: scikit-learn: 0.19.0 numpy: 1.15.1 keras: 2.2.2 scipy: 0.19.1 tensorflow: 1.10.0 pytorch: 0.4.1 Hmm, when I run conda list it shows tensorflow 1.7.0 and tensorflow-gpu 1.7.0 I then ran pip install -U tensorflow and pip install -U tensorflow-gpu to upgrade both to version 1.10.0 and then re-ran pip install autokeras

comments.comment: I will release a new version of autokeras using tensorflow 1.10.0 instead. Thanks. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cpoptic>@cpoptic</denchmark-link>
@jhfjhfj1 it's mid-November and I still seem to have this issue when I try to install with pip3
